revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Blitzz |model=BWA711 |revision=v2 (??) |upc=892620000115 |ean= |asin=B000220DEO |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=06/09/2004 |manuf_country= |manuf=XAVi |manuf_model=XG6640g |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=RYU-XG6640G |ic_id= |pwr_v=15 |pwr_amp=0.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR2112 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6060 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=Blitzz |default_ssid_regex=^Blitzz$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:01:38 |oui_eth=00:01:38 |default_ch= }} "jent" and "XG6640 Wireless Gateway Rev: 0.1" are silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Per the manual, the default SSID is '''Blitzz'''. WiGLE data shows the '''Blitzz''' SSID has three main OUIs - 00:E0:98 (AboCom), 00:01:38 (XAVi), and 00:03:6D (Runtop). The OUI for the device is presumed to be 00:01:38.
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is an ''OEM'' AD-1550 (120VAC ~ 60Hz, 13W -> 15VDC, 500mA).
